info.title: Order Service API
info.description:
The retail.red Order API is designed to support all order related functionality including
* Order Submission (Create)
* Order Modification (Update / Cancellation)
* Order Fulfillment (Processing Fulfillment Orders)

This API leverages the standard retail.red REST API authenication method.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: Filters as json string to be applied. Available filter per status and locationCode.

get.summary: Get fulfillment order breakdown by intervals
get.description: Get fulfillment order breakdown by intervals

parameters.name: merchantCode
parameters.description: Unique merchant code which represents the unique "merchant account".

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: Desired timezone to respresent date / time response

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: Desired group or summary to return results in

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description:
Filter string. Available filters: date, platform, deviceType.

The date filter is mandatory and has to be located under a first-level $and query.

Use filter types $lte and $gte to filter for a start or end date respectively.

The date can be the date without the timezone like "2020-01-01", in which case the start/end date based on
the resolution and timezone passed as query parameters will be used.

In the case of a full date-time string like "2020-01-01T00:00:00+01:00" that will override the timezone
parameter passed in the query.

If only the start date ($gte) was passed, the end date will be set to the end of the start date's day.
If only the end date ($lte) was passed, the start date will be set to the beginning of the end date's day.

Examples:
`{"$and":[{"date":{"$gte":"2021-04-16T00:00:00Z"}}]}` - results in a search starting at 2021-04-16T00:00:01Z
and ending 2021-04-16T23:59:59Z.
`{"$and":[{"date":{"$lte":"2021-04-16T23:59:59Z"}}]}` - is equivalent to the above search

id.description: Line Item id of the item to update. In case of an insert this field is not required

post.description:
### Creating fulfillments for directShip fulfillmentOrders
Creating fulfillments for fulfillmentOrders of type **directShip** requires the following fields, although they are not marked as required by the API documentaion:

  - serviceLevel
  - carrier
  - package code or package dimensions
  - weight

Additionally, the fulfillmentOrder address has to contain the following fields:

  - firstName
  - lastName
  - address1
  - city
  - postalCode
  - emailAddress
  - country

limit.description: items per page, for pagination, default is 10, max is 100

QuantityChangeReason.description:
## Reason for a quantity change.
Needs to be set if a new quantity is set.

## Deprecated reasons:
  * wrongAttribute
  * wrongProduct
  * changedMind
  * brokenOrDamaged
  * outOfStock

orderNumber.description: Number of the Order. Its need to be unique in the system

expedited.description: Indicates if the order needs to be threated expediently

shippingSubTotal.description: Shipping total without any discounts. Its based on the lineitems in the order

shippingDiscountAmount.description: Sum of discounts applied to the shipping total

total.description: Total sum of the order incluing tax, shipping and discounts

id.description: Line Item id of the item to update. In case of an insert this field is not required

coupons.description: Coupon of the order. If the order is in the status new only the code needs to be passed For all other status the whole object should to be filled out with to have all information of the coupons persist for transparency purposes.

fulfillmentSlots.description: Selected fulfillment slots of the selected locations. You can only select on slot per location

customer.description: Customer of the order. This property only exists if 'customer' is passed in the field query parameter.

isOrderable.description: Indicates if this order is orderable. Its used for the checkout. This property only exists if 'isOrderable' is passed in the field query parameter.

expedited.description: Indicates if the order needs to be threated expediently

coupons.description: Coupon of the order. If the order is in the status new only the code needs to be passed For all other status the whole object should to be filled out with to have all information of the coupons persist for transparency purposes.

addressSequences.description: If the array is set it will replace all addresses

customer.description: Updates the given attribute for the newly created anonymous customer

code.description: Code of the defined customer attribute

value.description: Value for this attribute. Its a free text field for attributes where no values are set. Attributes which have value set should contains the code in an object. For instance `value: { "code": "fish" }`

locationCode.description: Location code which should fulfill the order

sequenceId.description: If not provided it will automatically be set to the highest so far incremented by 1.

locationCode.description: Location code which should fulfill the order

pickingBatchId.description: Indicates wether this FO is part of an active picking batch

locationCode.description: Location code which should fulfill the order

entityId.description: Id of the subentity which the history entry belongs to

from.description: Hour and minute of the day where the time should start

orderLimit.description: Limit of orders which can be placed in this slot. This value can only be set for the type fulfillmentSlot

customerContactId.description: 'addressSequences' with type 'billing' must include either a 'customerContactId' or all of 'firstName', 'lastName' and 'emailAddress'

firstName.description: 'addressSequences' with type 'billing' must include either a 'customerContactId' or all of 'firstName', 'lastName' and 'emailAddress'

lastName.description: 'addressSequences' with type 'billing' must include either a 'customerContactId' or all of 'firstName', 'lastName' and 'emailAddress'

emailAddress.description: 'addressSequences' with type 'billing' must include either a 'customerContactId' or all of 'firstName', 'lastName' and 'emailAddress'

availableShippingMethods.description: Contains all shipping method which are available fro this order segment. This property is only set if the order was not placed yet and is in the new status

fulfillmentDate.description: The date and time of the package entering status "inTransit" or "fulfilled".
The date and time of the package entering status "inTransit" or "fulfilled".

substitutionAllowed.description: Determines if a substitution is allowed for this line item.
Determines if a substitution is allowed for this line item.

overall.description: Limit for the overall usage of this coupon

maxPerCustomer.description: Indicates how often this coupon can be used per customer

code.description: Identifier for the line item. Needs to be unique within the sales order.

routedQuantity.description: Sum of this line item in fulfillment orders.

shipToAddressSequenceIndex.description: Index of the address in the address sequence array where it should be shipped to

substitutionAllowed.description: Determines if a substitution is allowed for this line item.

image.description: Main image url of the product

checkoutParams.description: Different from payment method to payment method

code.description: External error code of the provider

type.description: Is set if the type is cc

field.description: the parameter-field, that failed to validate, like "shopNumber"

value.description: the value, that was sent, like "xxx"

example.message: Request validation failed: Parameter (shopNumber) is not a valid int64 integer: 100n06

CreateDate.description: Date of the order when it was created in the retail.red system

SubmitDate.description: Date when the order was submitted by the customer

AcceptDate.description: Date when the order status was changed to accepted

ReadyDate.description: Date when the order status was changed to ready

PlannedFulfillmentDate.description: Start of the planned fulfillment window

CompleteDate.description: Date when the order status was changed to completed

HeldUntil.description: Date until which order is held for pickup.

PickupReminderApplicableAt.description: Date when pickup reminder can be sent out.

ExternalCustomerNumber.description: A customer number / reference to an external system.

ExtendedPrice.description: The extended price is an absolute number indicating the final price of a lineitem including promo, discount, and taxes (if applicable)

TaxAmount.description: Tax amount of the first tax group (e.g. for german taxes this is an absolut number based on either 7% or 19% of the order total; the order total is 10.00 EUR so the taxAmount is 10.00 EUR * 0.19 = 1.9 EUR)

Tax2Amount.description: Tax amount of the second tax group (can be used for additional taxes like for example US state taxes)

PromoAmount.description: Total amount of all applied promotions for the line item. (Formular: (lineItem.product.effectivePrice + unitPromoAmount) * lineItem.quantity)

DiscountAmount.description: Total amount of all applied promotions with coupons for the line item. (Formular: (lineItem.product.effectivePrice + unitDiscountAmount) * lineItem.quantity)

UnitPromoAmount.description: Amount of all applied promotions for a single unit. Its calculated based on the effectivePrice of a product

UnitDiscountAmount.description: Amount of all applied promotions with coupons for a single unit. Its calculated based on the line item price after the promo amount was applied

SpecialInstructions.description: Special instructions of the order. It can contain special shipping or fulfillment instructions

SourceIP.description: IP address from the client where the order was placed. It can be a IPv4 or IPv6 address

UserAgent.description: The UserAgnt string from headers of the incoming request.

Domain.description: The domain from which order came.

Platform.description: The platform from which the order came.

OS.description: Operation system of the source device

Imported.description: Indicates if the order has been imported from an external system. Enableing this flag means that there will be no further processes triggered by this order like emitting events, calculating properties like prices, or starting payment transactions.

CampaignAttribution.description: Campaign the order should be attributed to

AppliedPromotions.description: Applied promotions of the order. If the order is in the status new this parameter will be ignored. The system will automatically calc the promotions for the order

description.example: This promotion is for our summer coupons

promotionalText.example: This coupons gives you 10% off to celebrate the summer 2020
promotionalText.description: Promotional text that will be displayed to the customer

impact.description: Describes the impact of the promotion to specific line items. This only applies to BOGO promotions

conditions.description:
Condition for products which should be impacted by the promotion This only applies to BOGO promotions.
Available condition fields are:
  • lineItem.product.code
  • lineItem.product.categoryCode
  • lineItem.product.price
  • lineItem.product.salePrice
  • lineItem.product.quantity
  • lineItem.product.options.<optionsCode>
  • lineItem.product.properties.<propertyCode>
The condition lineItem.quantity is always required. It needs to be set in the first level or in the $and condition on the first level

automaticallyAddedToCart.description:
Indicates if the product which the customer would receive is automatically added to the cart.
This only applies if the condition has one rule with a single product code

code.description: Unique coupon code. This code can be used by the end customer to activate a promotion in his cart.

overall.description: Limit for the overall usage of this coupon

maxPerCustomer.description: Indicates how often this coupon can be used per customer

count.description: Only available and must be set for generated couponSet type.

description.example: This coupon set contains all coupons for 2020

limitConditions.description:
Set the limits how often the promotion can be used by a customer and with which other promotion it can be combined. For the field cantBeCombinedWithPromotionCode promotion code(s) can be given or a special code anyProductPromotions|anyOrderPromotions that will exclude any product|order promotion when it gets calculated. Available condition fields are:
  • maxOverallUsageCount
  • maxCustomerUsageCount
  • maxUsagePerOrder (only works for target=product)
  • cantBeCombinedWithPromotionCode

reason.example: Planet pluto was not found (did you mean dwarf planet pluto?)
